original_text: Patient reports chest pain radiating to the left arm, shortness of breath, and sweating. ECG shows ST elevation.
The subject is a 45-year-old male with a history of diabetes. Presented with fever, cough, and loss of appetite.
MRI scan reveals a mass in the right temporal lobe. Biopsy recommended for further evaluation.
Patient experienced severe headache, blurred vision, and high blood pressure. Suspected hypertensive crisis.
Individual presents with fatigue, pale skin, and low hemoglobin levels. Possible diagnosis: anemia.
